channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024030056
item.description:
Report X-2024030056

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT DOOR WEARING PROPER PPE. PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ONTO THE TRAILER FLOOR. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE REPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024021764
item.description:
Report X-2024021764

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had been improperly loaded into the trailer which caused the spill incident to occur by the packing becoming crushed. Once it was discovered, action was taken to isolate the scene from package handlers and to contain all damaged packages affected, including the culprit package within the hazmat processing area for further investigation and processing. DescribePack: Package had been poorly loaded into the trailer by the previous station, that the package had become crushed from the weight of the packages on top of it. One bottle had been crushed enough to be punctured and leak. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Effort was taken to mitigate the release effects by containing the damaged boxes and culprit hazmat in hazmat bags and totes and neutralizing the spill with an absorbent spill aid.

item.title: Report X-2024021637
item.description:
Report X-2024021637

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKIING HAZMAT. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR WITH THE BOTTOM WET. RESPONDER OPENED THE PACKAGE TO FIND 1 GALLON MISSING THE CAP. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED

item.title: Report X-2024021684

  • City: CHARLOTTE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON IR-1. HAZMAT REPORTED TO THE SPIL OBSERVED THE PACKAGE AND FOLLOWED RESPONSE SHEET WHICH HAD RESPONDER USE PH TAPE TO CONFIRM ACIDITY AND NEUTRALIZED BEFORE CLEAN UP. RESPONDER THEN BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL

item.title: Report X-2024021745
item.description:
Report X-2024021745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped off from one of our unload areas in our building, moment I noticed was leaking placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: The bottom side of the package was wet and began to show signs of starting to be weakening due to being soaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package itself including with the contents were placed in a lined tote and any wet areas were cleaned up spill fix in our building.

item.title: Report X-2024021763
item.description:
Report X-2024021763

  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE BOX WAS FOUND DAMAGED WHEN THEY WERE UNLOADING A TRAILER. A MANAGER WAS NOTIFIED AND PLACED IT IN A LINED HAZARDOUS CONTAINER WITH A LID AND BROUGHT IT TO QA DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FAILURE WAS DUE TO THE CAP BEING LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE CAP WAS TIGHTEN TO PREVENT FURTHER LEAKAGE AND IT WAS PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM WITH THE LID CLOSED.

item.description:

  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WHEN AN EMPLOYEE WAS UNLOADING A TRAILER. A MANGER WAS NOTIFIED AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED HAZARDOUS TOTE WITH A LID. DescribePack: 2 OF THE BOTTLES CAPS WERE NOT SUCURE (DEFECTIVE) AND THE CONTENTS WERE LEAKING INSIDE THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE BOTTLES WERE PLACED IN A YELLOW LINED SALVAGE DRUM WITH A LID

item.title: Report X-2024021876
item.description:
Report X-2024021876

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was left at QA on Tuesday morning in a lined hazmat tote. We inspected the package and found that one of the 4 plastic bottles had a loose cap and it caused a 1/2 gallon of the material to leak out inside the package which contaminated all of the contents in the box. We made sure that the package was isolated under the hood vent inside the hazmat cage. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure that the package was isolated inside the hazmat cage upon discovery.

item.title: Report X-2024021424
item.description:
Report X-2024021424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021424 SequenceEvent: package found on dock with external leakage. package was then placed into a salvage drum for further investigation. DescribePack: Upon investigation, station had found that there was a loose cap causing internal leakage on one of the four inner containers. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed into a hazard bag, and then into a salvage drum. 2. X-2024021425 SequenceEvent: Package was found on dock with wet outer packaging. Package was then placed in a salvage drum for further investigation DescribePack: Upon investigation, station found that there was a loose cap on one of the four inner containers. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a harzard bag, then into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021414
item.description:
Report X-2024021414

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE CAME DOWN THE IC BELT ALREADY OUTSIDE OF THE EXTERIOR FIBERBOARD BOX. WE WERE WERE CALLED BECAUSE OF THE LEAK AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS BUCKET/PAIL. IT WAS ALREADY CONTAINED IN A LINED TOTE. WE DISCOVERED A CRACK ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BUCKET. DescribePack: 10 INCH CRACK ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BUCKET DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE MADE SURE THAT WE ISOLATED THIS PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024021340
item.description:
Report X-2024021340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was put on the IC rollers and then it moved onto the van line belt. Package handler was not aware of the package coming up from the IC rollers which caused the package to fall from the belt onto the van line platform. The fall caused a dent in the framing where the lid was secured which caused the lid to be removed partially releasing 4 out of 5 gallons of the chemical onto the van platform and the ground bellow it. No other packages where damaged in this incident. DescribePack: Small dent on the top portion of the bucket keeping the lid from being secured further. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was delivered to QA Immediately and spill was cleaned up with dry dirt.
